properties.Name: GenomicEncounter
properties.Description:
A contact between an individual and the health care system for a health care service or set of services related to one or more medical conditions involving one or more tests, service, medical procedures, products, items, ancillary services etc. 

Some organizations refer to this as an Episode of Care, while others prefer to think of a group of related Encounters as an Episode of Care.

Columns.Name: EncounterId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Encounter with a Service Provider.

Columns.Name: EncounterStartTimestamp
Columns.Description: The period start timestamp of treatment between admission and discharge from a modality, e.g., inpatient, residential, partial hospitalization, and outpatient, or the period of time between the first procedure and last procedure on an outpatient basis for a given diagnosis. Many healthcare statistics and profiles use this unit as a base for comparisons.

Columns.Name: EncounterEndTimestamp
Columns.Description: The period end timestamp of treatment between admission and discharge from a modality, e.g., inpatient, residential, partial hospitalization, and outpatient, or the period of time between the first procedure and last procedure on an outpatient basis for a given diagnosis. Many healthcare statistics and profiles use this unit as a base for comparisons.

Columns.Name: SubjectId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Subject.

Columns.Name: ReferringServiceProviderId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of the referring Service Provider.

Columns.Name: AdmittingDiagnosisStatement
Columns.Description: Words that your doctor uses to describe your condition

Columns.Name: PrincipalDiagnosisStatement
Columns.Description: The medical condition that is ultimately determined to have caused a patient's admission to the hospital. The principal diagnosis is used to assign every patient to a diagnosis related group. This diagnosis may differ from the admitting and major diagnoses.

Columns.Name: EndOfEncounterDiagnosisStatement
Columns.Description: The final diagnosis associated with the encounter, which means identifying a disease by its signs, symptoms, and laboratory findings

Columns.Name: MemberBeneficiaryLiabilityStatement
Columns.Description: A statement that you are responsible for some treatments or charges.

Columns.Name: LengthOfStay
Columns.Description: LOS expressed in hours refers to the length of stay. It is a term used by insurance companies, case managers and/or employers to describe the amount of time an individual stays in a hospital or in-patient facility.

Columns.Name: EncounterNotes
Columns.Description: Notes, comments or additional information regarding the encounter.

Columns.Name: HealthcareFacilityId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Healthcare Facility.

Columns.Name: FacilityFloorplanLocationId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Facility Floorplan Location.

Columns.Name: MemberPreauthorizationCode
Columns.Description: The preauthorization code assigned to the member. The number stating that your treatment has been approved by your insurance plan.

Columns.Name: ResultOfWorkRelatedAccidentIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that the encounter is a result of a work-related accident.

Columns.Name: UncompensatedCareIndicator
Columns.Description:
Service provided by physicians and hospitals for which no payment is received from the patient or from third-party payers. 

Some costs for these services may be covered through cost-shifting. Not all uncompensated care results from charity care. It also includes bad debts from persons who are not classified as charity cases but who are unable or unwilling to pay their bill. See cost shifting.

Columns.Name: OutOfNetworkEncounterIndicator
Columns.Description: Services performed by a provider who has not signed a contract with the member's health plan to be part of a provider network.

Columns.Name: ReferralRequiredIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that a referral is required as a result of the encounter.

Columns.Name: EmploymentIllnessRelatedIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates whether the illness was job-related.

Columns.Name: DisabledIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates if the encounter is due to a disability.

Columns.Name: ReAdmissionIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates whether the Encounter is the result of a re-admission.

Columns.Name: CaseManagerId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a case manager.

Columns.Name: TriageClassificationId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Triage Classification.

Columns.Name: EncounterTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Encounter Type.

Columns.Name: AdmissionLevelOfCareId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Admission Level Of Care.

Columns.Name: HealthProgramId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Product.

Columns.Name: MedicaidCaseName
Columns.Description: The case name assigned by Medicaid.

Columns.Name: MedicaidCaseNumber
Columns.Description: The case number assigned by Medicaid.

Properties.Description:
A contact between an individual and the health care system for a health care service or set of services related to one or more medical conditions involving one or more tests, service, medical procedures, products, items, ancillary services etc. 

Some organizations refer to this as an Episode of Care, while others prefer to think of a group of related Encounters as an Episode of Care.
